author: tbenr
content:
I discovered there was the same key (at least one) that was running on `prysm/nethermind` and `teku/geth`. This explained what I discovered here: https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/1151915778308845648/1151986098780778586

I guess no slasher is running so no slashing occurred.

Was it an intended setup?

author: tbenr
content: fortunately teku nodes are configured to store non-canonical blocks so I have the proof ðŸ™‚

author: tbenr
content: but there ore other more recent instances where proposers were effectively different..

content: but there ore other more recent

author: rjected
rjected
content: Maybe I'm misinterpreting what clients should do? I was implementing a check that just stops the node when loading the genesis, if it has an empty account

author: rjected
content: tests should still remove the empty accounts from the genesis alloc ig

author: rjected
content: ~~ah, maybe we should just check for an empty system account? instead of any account~~ nvm, it does seem like the outcome of the call was to disallow any empty account
